docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. House of Representatives committee on Thursday unanimously approved a bill to speed new drugs to the market, overcoming last-minute wrangling over how to pay for the legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration gave people facing a tax penalty a second chance to sign up for health insurance. Few took it.

headline.main: Ignoring the Penalty for Not Buying Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Health Law Penalty Is Seen Falling Short of Aims

docs.abstract: The Upshot; federal government says 11.7 million people chose health insurance marketplace plans or renewed them from 2014 as of end of enrollment plan in February; some experts think 2016 sign-ups will be below forecasts, even with penalties for not signing up.
docs.snippet: The Obama administration gave people facing a tax penalty a second chance to sign up for health insurance. Few took it.

docs.lead_paragraph: The hacking of CareFirst, a health insurer, may have some common links to the attacks on Anthem and Premera.

headline.main: Up to 1.1 Million Customers Could be Affected in Data Breach at Insurer CareFirst
headline.print_headline: Up to 1.1 Million Customers Could be Affected in Data Breach at Insurer CareFirst

docs.abstract: Health insurer CareFirst says hackers accessed its computer systems and possibly compromised some of its customer information, possibly affecting as many as 1.1 million customers.
docs.snippet: The hacking of CareFirst, a health insurer, may have some common links to the attacks on Anthem and Premera.

byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and REED ABELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Mitch McConnell faces the prospect of having to embrace a former foe, Matt Bevin, who is in a tight Republican primary race with James R. Comer.

headline.main: In Kentucky, Republican Primary Yields Disarray
headline.print_headline: Kentucky G.O.P. Left in Disarray by a Close Race

docs.abstract: Wealthy businessman and Tea Party darling Matt Bevin has emerged as possible Republican nominee for governor amid razor-thin primary contest in Kentucky; Bevin currently leads by 83 votes, and opponent James R Comer has called for recanvassing; drama has left Kentucky Republican Party in disarray, and could force Senate Republican Leader Mitch McConnell to campaign in his home state for a man who attempted to unseat him in 2014.
docs.snippet: Senator Mitch McConnell faces the prospect of having to embrace a former foe, Matt Bevin, who is in a tight Republican primary race with James R. Comer.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court has rejected the University of Notre Dame's request to temporarily be exempt from a provision in the Affordable Care Act that requires the Catholic school's insurance providers to cover the costs of contraceptives for students and staff.

headline.main: Court Won't Exempt Notre Dame From Birth Control Provision
headline.print_headline: Court Won't Exempt Notre Dame From Birth Control Provision

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court has rejected the University of Notre Dame's request to temporarily be exempt from a provision in the Affordable Care Act that requires the Catholic school's insurance providers to cover the costs of contraceptives for students...
